channel.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
channel.description:
Well if you have fibre optic and are right next to a web server you can get speeds like this:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/7857020.stm

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:33, topic:259130”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=342169.msg2648883#msg2648883 date=1233421986]
I bet you think 1 gigabyte is 1000 megabytes, too
[/quote]

I’m not that thick. Well i can be but not in that field![/quote]
…no.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:

I bet you think 1 gigabyte is 1000 megabytes, too

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:30, topic:259130”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=342169.msg2648706#msg2648706 date=1233414123]

1 megabyte = 8 megabits

or rather, 1 byte = 8 bit

Oh thats why i get confused when people advertise 8 megabit broadband. They need to change it because Megabit is a stupid term that nobody uses to count digital files! The right way is Megabytes and ISP’s should be fined for misleading people!
[/quote]

I bet you think 1 gigabyte is 1000 megabytes, too ;)[/quote]
1024

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

im reconnecting the virgin line outside my window at the end of this month

I chose the 20MB package because i couldnt justify the extra £10 a month for it. im sure ill be happy, my sky 8MG deal goes to about 1.2 due to my location from the BT exchange.

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:28, topic:259130”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=342169.msg2648699#msg2648699 date=1233413569]
1 megabyte = 8 megabits

or rather, 1 byte = 8 bit
[/quote]

Oh thats why i get confused when people advertise 8 megabit broadband. They need to change it because Megabit is a stupid term that nobody uses to count digital files! The right way is Megabytes and ISP’s should be fined for misleading people![/quote]

I bet you think 1 gigabyte is 1000 megabytes, too

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

No they don’t. Usually speeds are measured in bits (kilobits/megabits/gigabits) and file sizes are measured in bytes.

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:27, topic:259130”]1 megabyte = 8 megabits

or rather, 1 byte = 8 bit[/quote]

Oh thats why i get confused when people advertise 8 megabit broadband. They need to change it because Megabit is a stupid term that nobody uses to count digital files! The right way is Megabytes and ISP’s should be fined for misleading people!

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Can you Explain the difference between MBps and mbps? My actual spped is only around 200kb/s!

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:259130”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=342169.msg2647309#msg2647309 date=1233320282]
yeah but they said that in our area we should achieve speeds of nearly 16mb/s and we’re only just cracking 2
[/quote]

Are you sure your are not confusing mbps and MBps? I have 7mbps internet, which works out to be around 1.5 MBps, and my actual download speed turns out to be about 750 KBps.[/quote]
they said 16megabits per second, which is two megabytes per second we are getting 1771kilobits per second

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:21, topic:259130”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=342169.msg2647296#msg2647296 date=1233318856]
They can’t magically make ADSL not shit, try moving to a city if you want 16mb/s
[/quote]
I live very close to Central London and still get 2mb/s when i should get 8mb

I might make a topic about how Broadband ISP’s rip you off with broadband that 4 times as slow as it should be. This is a real problem in the UK.[/quote]

Bad quality line/bad filter setup/QoS issue

Have you tried actually resolving it with BT/Openreach?

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:

She needs to download a diet plan.

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:14, topic:259130”][quote author=Niall link=topic=342169.msg2646113#msg2646113 date=1233250960]
It’s great how they’re promoting piracy, then whine about things like streaming sites hogging bandwidth.

Still, £1 for 30 minutes is a complete rip off. £48 For a day of 100mb speeds, and I’m guessing there’s a cap on how much you can use it.

Virgin offers 20mb for £29(For the first 12 months, then £36 a month after that) and while it was raised from £20, you’ll be paying 72 times less for it. Even Virgin’s 50mb package is 42 times less a month.
[/quote]
They weren’t promoting piracy, she stated she bought the movie of iTunes (was shown, too)
She wouldn’t use it 24/7 either, so it wouldn’t be costing £48. Just for when she said she downloads movies.

That is some fast shit, though.
Beats my 24mb/s.[/quote]It’s kind of implied though. People are not stupid… The majority of people know about and download movies/music anyway. If anything it’s just opening people’s eyes and broadening their view on the topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:10, topic:259130”]It’s great how they’re promoting piracy, then whine about things like streaming sites hogging bandwidth.

Still, £1 for 30 minutes is a complete rip off. £48 For a day of 100mb speeds, and I’m guessing there’s a cap on how much you can use it.

Virgin offers 20mb for £29(For the first 12 months, then £36 a month after that) and while it was raised from £20, you’ll be paying 72 times less for it. Even Virgin’s 50mb package is 42 times less a month.[/quote]
They weren’t promoting piracy, she stated she bought the movie of iTunes (was shown, too)
She wouldn’t use it 24/7 either, so it wouldn’t be costing £48. Just for when she said she downloads movies.

That is some fast shit, though.
Beats my 24mb/s.

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Niall:

Even Virgin’s 50mb package is 42 times less a month.

Problem, Most people will have to wait till Summer!

But i dont because its already avaliable in South London aka My Area. Why am I so lucky

bootnecklad:

Although we still get around 3 or 4 Mbps.

I have the same problem, Do you think that becuase i signed up for 2mb/s a long time ago and that BT are still limiting my serivce even though the package has been upgraded to 8mb/s

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

You still need the fibre optic cables other wise your fucked… (We have dodgy old copper cables that are minimum of 20 years old…) Although we still get around 3 or 4 Mbps.

Read full topic

item.title: Show off uses 100Mbps Broadband
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

It’s great how they’re promoting piracy, then whine about things like streaming sites hogging bandwidth.

Still, £1 for 30 minutes is a complete rip off. £48 For a day of 100mb speeds, and I’m guessing there’s a cap on how much you can use it.

Virgin offers 20mb for £29(For the first 12 months, then £36 a month after that) and while it was raised from £20, you’ll be paying 72 times less for it. Even Virgin’s 50mb package is 42 times less a month.
